translation: It was then that the Evil One addressed the mother of suffering, saying, The Śākya clansmen of Kapilavastu are so brave and difficult to overcome. They now close the city gates and go up to the city wall to guard it.

translation: In accordance with this reasoning, the first is to deceive. The envoys are sent to that king who holds the instruction and tells him, “Now I have affection for kindness but do not really have bad intentions.

source_sentence: 緣有少事要欲入城，幸為開門暫見容納，即還速出不敢停留。』」
translation: Because there are few things that I want to enter the city, I'm fortunate to open the door for you and see your containment for a moment, so I'll quickly come back out and won't stay.'

source_sentence: 依計至彼傳如上說，城內諸人共集議論：「為當放入？
translation: Relying on the above-mentioned explanation, the people in the city gathered together to discuss it and said, Will you put it in?

source_sentence: 為不許耶？」
translation: Why won't you allow it?

source_sentence: 或言：「放入。」
translation: Some say, Put it in.

source_sentence: 或言：「不可。」
translation: Some say, No.

translation: Some people may say, There's one place where you can gather together to practice the chips, and if you play a lot of them, you should follow their words.

source_sentence: 眾然其說，即共行籌。
translation: The crowd, however, explained it, and they all shared the chips.

source_sentence: 是時罪惡魔王作如是念：「我常隨逐沙門喬答摩，覓其瑕隙不能得便。
translation: The evil demon king then had this thought, I always followed the ascetic Gautama, looking for his flaws and couldn't get an advantage over him.

source_sentence: 我今宜可害彼眷屬，正是其時。」
translation: Now is the right time for me to harm those members of my family.

source_sentence: 即便變身作老釋子，居其上座先受取籌，以次諸人見彼受籌，咸云：「老宿既受，
translation: He then transformed himself into the old Śākyamuni and took his seat at the top of the throne, where he accepted the chips.

source_sentence: 我何不取？」
translation: Why don't I take it?

source_sentence: 于時眾內多人受籌，既見籌多遂即開門令王軍入。
translation: Many people in the assembly then accepted the chips, and when they saw the chips, they opened the door and ordered the king's army to enter.

source_sentence: 王曰：「我已棄捨劫比羅城，諸釋迦子任情誅殺。」
translation: The king said, I've abandoned the city of Kapilavastu, and the Śākyamunis are free to kill them.

source_sentence: 眾聞教已，便縱四兵，旗鼓震天，囂聲聒地，隨處誅戮無悲愍心。
translation: The four divisions of the army joined together and shook the sky with their flags and drums, clamorously screaming in unison. People were slaughtered everywhere without compassion or pity.

source_sentence: 時釋種大名見此事已，於諸眷屬起極悲憐，頭髮蓬亂即疾往詣惡生之所白言：「大王當與我願。」
translation: Seeing this, the great name of the Śākyamuni clan became so compassionate to his followers that his hair stood on end and he quickly went to the bad man's place and said, Great king, you will give me my vow.

source_sentence: 王曰：「欲須何願？」
translation: The king said, What do you want?

source_sentence: 白言：「於諸釋種幸施無畏。」
translation: He said, They're fortunate and fearless in giving to the Śākyamunis.

source_sentence: 王曰：「諸餘釋種我不能捨，汝之家屬隨意當出。」
translation: The king said, I can't abandon the other Śākyamunis; your family will go out as you wish.

source_sentence: 答曰：「我今入池自沈水底，乃至我身未出已來，眷屬皆放。」
translation: He answered, Now, I'll enter the pond and drown myself at the bottom of the water... until my body doesn't emerge, and all my followers will be released.

source_sentence: 王聞是語目視諸臣，諸臣白王：「此大名者是先王親友，允其所願。」
translation: When the king heard these words, he looked at his ministers and said to the king, This great man is a friend of the late king who grants his wishes.

source_sentence: 王言：「若爾少時令出。」
translation: The king said, If you do so for a little while, I'll let you go.

source_sentence: 是時大名既蒙許已，悲愍眷屬憂惱纏心，疾往赴池自沈水底，即以頭髮繫著樹根，
translation: At that time Mahāprajāpaṇa, having received the king’s approval, was overcome with sorrow and distress from his dependents. He quickly went to the bottom of the pond where he drowned himself, clinging to the roots of the tree.

source_sentence: 因茲而死。
translation: Because of this, he died.

source_sentence: 時諸釋種，於過去時不同業者出城而去，或往末羅國、或往泥波羅、或往其餘聚落城邑。
translation: At the time, the Śākyas had different karmas in the past that they left the city and departed, either to the country of Māra, or to Nirvāṇa, or to other villages and cities.

source_sentence: 若於昔時同惡業者，雖出東門，南門還入；
translation: If they had done the same evil deeds in the past, they would have left the eastern gate and returned through the southern gate.

source_sentence: 南門出，西門入；
translation: The south gate came out and the west gate entered.

source_sentence: 西門出，北門入；
translation: The west gate came out and the north gate entered.

source_sentence: 北門出，東門入。
translation: The north gate comes out, and the east gate enters.

source_sentence: 諸臣見已而白王曰：「今時釋種皆自燒煮。
translation: Seeing this, the ministers said to the king, “At the present time the Śākya clan is all burned and cooked by themselves.

source_sentence: 以何得知？
translation: How can we know it?

source_sentence: 諸門出者悉皆還入。」
translation: Those who emerge from the gates all return to enter.

source_sentence: 王曰：「速看大名，入水何久？」
translation: The king said, Quickly look at the great name; how long has it been since he entered the water?

source_sentence: 遣使觀之。
translation: He sent an envoy to examine it.

source_sentence: 見其已死，還白：「王知，彼已命過。」
translation: Seeing him dead, he returned and said, The king knows that they've committed a crime.

source_sentence: 王加瞋怒即告臣曰：「可設高座，我昇其上躬自瞻望。
translation: The king became angry and said to his ministers, “ Set up a high seat.

source_sentence: 若我不見人血橫流騰波街巷者，我終不能身離此座。」
translation: If I don't see human blood flowing across the streets and lanes, I won't be able to leave this seat.

source_sentence: 即登座遙望。
translation: He then ascended to his seat and looked from a distance.

source_sentence: 諸勇健人被殺之時，法爾血少，諸臣議曰：「仁等應知，今此惡王作大罪業，
translation: When the brave and strong men were killed, only a small amount of blood fell to their bodies according to the law. The ministers said in council, “O gentlemen! You should know that this evil king is now committing a great sin.

source_sentence: 自為要契望血橫流。
translation: It's because it's essential to hope that the blood will flow horizontally.

source_sentence: 何處得有如斯之事？
translation: Where could there be such a thing?

source_sentence: 宜取紫礦煮令色赤，盛滿千瓨當街傾瀉，觀其流去與血不殊。」
translation: It's better to take the purple ore and boil it so that it becomes red, fill a thousand bowls with it, pour it down the street, and observe its flowing away without differing from the blood.

source_sentence: 如計便作，報言：「血至。」
translation: As he thought, he did so, and reported, The blood arrived.

source_sentence: 惡生遙見謂其是血，便作是念：「我今望足，宜可歸還。」
translation: Seeing it from a distance, the bad creature said to him, This is blood, and he thought, Now that I'm expecting my feet, it's better for me to return.

source_sentence: 時惡生愚人，抂殺釋種七萬七千，此諸人內多是見聖諦者，殺戮如是諸賢善已，
translation: At that time there were seventy-thousand and seventy-seven thousand ignorant people of evil birth among the Śākya clan. Many of these people, who saw the holy truth within themselves, slaughtered this kind of group of good men.

source_sentence: 遂將釋種五百童男及五百童女，行至一園是外道住處，苦母白言：「此等千人皆是怨家，
translation: He then led the five hundred boys and five hundred girls of the Śākya clan to a park where the heretics lived. The mother of suffering said, “These thousand people are all enemies!

source_sentence: 何不總殺？」
translation: Why isn't it a general killing?

source_sentence: 王曰：「云何當殺？」
translation: The king said, How will you kill him?

source_sentence: 答曰：「令群象脚踏。」
translation: He answered, They cause the elephants to step on their feet.

source_sentence: 是時五百釋子有大勇力，撲象令倒手擎棄之。
translation: At the time, five hundred Śākyamuni sons had great courage and pushed the elephant so that it would fall over with their hands and be thrown away.

source_sentence: 苦母見已白惡生曰：「大王！
translation: Seeing this, the mother of suffering said to the Evil One, Great king!

source_sentence: 見此勇健人不？」
translation: Do you see this courageous man?

source_sentence: 王曰：「我見。」
translation: The king said, I see it.

source_sentence: 答曰：「若捨此徒，當與大王作無利益。」
translation: He answered, If you abandon these people, it won't be beneficial to give them to the great king.

source_sentence: 王言：「有實。
translation: The king said, There's truth.

source_sentence: 若為殺之？」
translation: If he kills them?

source_sentence: 答曰：「掘地作坑埋令頭出，上以鐵栿磨之令碎。」
translation: He answered, Digging into the ground makes a pit and buried it so that its head will come out, and grinding it with an iron wheel on top of it will cause it to break down.

source_sentence: 時有二童子走至佛所，爾時世尊欲令知業感報不虛，即以神力化鉢令大合二童子，
translation: Two boys then ran to the Buddha. The World-honored One, wishing to let them know the karmic retribution of their deeds would not be false, magically transformed the bowl and caused the two children Mahāprajāpaṇḍika and Mahāprajāpaṇḍika to join [the almsbowl].

source_sentence: 即於鉢下爛熟而終。
translation: He then rotted under the bowl and died.

source_sentence: 殺釋種時佛極頭痛，即告阿難陀曰：「盛水滿鉢持來我所。」
translation: When he killed the Śākyamuni, the Buddha had a great headache and told Ānanda, Fill your bowl with water and bring it to me.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀即授鉢水，是時世尊以額上汗兩三渧許置水鉢中，即便烟出震吒作聲，
translation: Ānanda then gave the bowl water, and when the Bhagavān put two or three taels of sweat on his forehead into the bowl with water, he smoked it out and produced a sound like cchanda.

source_sentence: 如以熱鐵投之於水。
translation: It's like throwing hot iron into water.

source_sentence: 是時惡生告一人曰：「汝當住此，佛若於我有所記者可速來報。」
translation: The evil being then told one person, You must stay here; if the Buddha has anything to report to me, he'll quickly report back.

source_sentence: 即將五百釋女還歸本國。
translation: The five hundred Śākya maidens then returned to their native land.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻見此事已咸有疑心，請世尊曰：「大德！
translation: Seeing this, the monks had doubts in their minds and asked the Bhagavān, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 因何業故令佛頭痛？
translation: What action causes the Buddha to have a headache?

source_sentence: 劫比羅城諸釋種等，復作何業，由彼為緣，實無罪犯，被愚癡惡生輒見誅戮？」
translation: What other actions did the Śākyamunis and others in Kapilavastu do that were really not crimes because of their conditions, and they were often killed by foolish and evil creatures?

source_sentence: 世尊告阿難陀曰：「汝今可去告諸苾芻：『咸應集在外道園中。』
translation: The Bhagavān told Ānanda, Now, you can go and tell the monks, 'We should all gather here in the garden of non-Buddhists.'

source_sentence: 我當為說愚癡惡生殺諸釋種先業因緣。」
translation: I will explain the causes and conditions of the previous actions of the Śākyamunis who were born in a foolish and evil way to kill.

source_sentence: 尊者受教即往白眾。
translation: The venerable received the teaching and went to the congregation to report it.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊與諸苾芻行詣彼園，時有婆羅門於其中路，遙見世尊作如是語：「喬答摩！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān and the monks went to that park, and a Brāhmaṇa who was walking there saw the Bhagavān from a distance and said, Gautama!

source_sentence: 愚癡惡生多造惡業，釋種無罪枉見殺害。」
translation: Foolish and bad-natured sentient beings often commit bad actions, and the Śākyamuni's seed is not guilty of killing in vain.

source_sentence: 佛告婆羅門：「如是，如是！
translation: The Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa, So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 愚癡惡生造作無量尤重惡業，釋種無罪枉為屠害。」
translation: Foolish bad sentient beings create measureless and especially serious bad actions, and the Śākyamuni's offspring are slaughtered without guilt or injustice.

source_sentence: 佛至園中見彼被磨童男童女尚有殘命，彼見佛時悉皆號泣。
translation: When the Buddha went to the park, he saw that boy and girl who had been polished still alive, and they all cried out when they saw the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊即便在其一面，於所敷座就之而坐，告諸苾芻曰：「劫比羅城諸釋種子，
translation: The World-honored One then stood to one side, sat cross-legged on the seat that was spread out for him, and said to the monks:

source_sentence: 已經三度被他屠殺出大叫聲。
translation: They've been slaughtered by others three times and produced a loud screaming sound.

source_sentence: 昔為漁人殺諸魚類，復於聚落傷害諸人，今於此時被惡生所殺，尚有殘命出大叫聲，
translation: Formerly a fisherman killed all kinds of fish and inflicted harm on the villagers, but now they are slaughtered by evil creatures at that time.

source_sentence: 與昔無異。
translation: It's no different from the past.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻頗曾聞見諸有獵師屠膾之類，以其自業活命之事，能得象馬車步威嚴熾盛不？」
translation: Have you monks ever heard or seen hunters and butchers who, because of their own livelihood, attain the authority and prestige of elephants, horses, chariots, and footsteps?

source_sentence: 諸苾芻言：「未曾聞見如此之事。」
translation: The monks said, Never have I heard or seen such a thing.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉苾芻！
translation: The Buddha said, Good, monks!

source_sentence: 我亦未曾聞見斯事，獵射之徒得有如是熾盛兵眾。
translation: I've never heard or seen anything like this, and the hunters and archers can have such a large army.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 由彼屠人有罪惡心伺求物命，緣斯惡業，不能獲得象馬車步熾盛威嚴多有財貨。
translation: Because the butcherer has a sinful and evil intention to seek property and life, and because of this bad action, he can't obtain elephants, horses, chariots, foots, carriages, blazingly powerful, and abundant possessions.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 由彼羊等禽獸之類被殺之時，以其惡心視彼人故，由斯不獲象馬車步及諸財物。
translation: Because when those sheep and other birds and animals are killed, they look at them with bad intentions and therefore don't get elephants, horses, chariots, feet, or property.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 彼畜生趣所有眾生惡眼看時，尚能令彼不得四兵及諸財寶，何況惡生愚癡垢重，
translation: When those sentient beings in the animal realm look at it with bad eyes, they can still prevent them from obtaining the four weapons and possessions, much less the stain of ignorance that is inherent in bad birth.

source_sentence: 殺彼學人具大威德持淨戒者，而能增盛象馬車步及諸財物，得安樂住不遭損滅，
translation: He kills those trainees who possess great authority and virtue and observe the pure precepts, yet he can increase elephants, horses, chariots, footsteps, and other possessions to attain peace and comfort and live without harming or destroying them.

source_sentence: 無有是處。
translation: There's no such place.

source_sentence: 汝等當知憍薩羅城，譬如毒龍所顧視處悉當滅壞，此城亦爾。
translation: You should know that the city of Kośala is like a poisonous dragon looking out for it, which will all perish and disintegrate. This city is also like this.

source_sentence: 七日之後，愚癡惡生及與苦母，被火所燒揚聲號叫，墮於無間大地獄中受極苦惱。
translation: After seven days, the foolish and bad-natured sentient beings and their mothers of suffering were burned by fire and cried out, and they fell into the great hell of unremitting suffering.

source_sentence: 是故汝等應如是知，於諸枯木尚息惡心，豈況其餘含識之類。」
translation: Therefore, you should thus know that bad thoughts are still stopped in dry wood, so why wouldn't they be stopped in other consciousnesses?

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻見是事已，咸皆有疑，請世尊曰：「此五百釋子曾作何業，由彼業力現無愆犯，
translation: When the monks saw this, they all had doubts and asked the Bhagavān, What actions did these five hundred sons of the Śākyamunis do in the past that made them manifest by the power of their actions without committing crimes?

source_sentence: 被愚人惡生枉見誅戮？
translation: They'll be killed by foolish people and bad beings with injusticeful views?

source_sentence: 又因何業，誅戮之時令佛頭痛？」
translation: What's the cause for causing the Buddha to have a headache when he's killed?

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「彼諸釋子及我前生所作之業，汝等善聽！
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Those Śākyamunis and the actions they did in my previous lives, listen well!

source_sentence: 彼所作業，因緣合會成熟之時，如瀑流水不能止遏，無代受者，廣如上說。
translation: When these actions are combined and matured by causes and conditions, it's like a flood that doesn't stop the water and there's no one who receives them as an obstacle, as explained above.

source_sentence: 乃至果報各還自受。
translation: It's even the result that each returns to receive it for himself.

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 乃往古昔，於一河邊有五百漁人依止而住，時有二大魚從海入河泝流而上。
translation: Ancient times long ago, when there were five hundred fishermen living on the edge of a river, two large fishes came from the ocean into the river and flowed upstream.

source_sentence: 彼見二魚情生喜悅，共張大網捕得其魚，見其極大共相議曰：『今欲如何？
translation: When they saw the two fish, their emotions became joyous and they opened a large net together to catch the fish. Seeing the huge fish, they said among themselves, 'What do you want?'

source_sentence: 魚既極大，若頓殺者肉便壞爛，何所用為？』
translation: Since the fish is so great, what's the use of a sudden killer whose flesh breaks up and rots?'

source_sentence: 或云：『且殺一魚、一繫在水。』
translation: Or they might say, 'Slay a fish or bind it to water.'

source_sentence: 或云：『二魚皆大。
translation: Some people say, 'The two fish are both large.

source_sentence: 若殺一者其肉亦壞，可繫於柱安在水中，勿令命斷，須肉之時生取而賣。』
translation: If he kills one, his flesh will also break apart, so he can tie it to a pillar and place it in water so that his life won't be cut off, and when he needs meat, he takes it and sells it.'

source_sentence: 咸言：『可爾。』
translation: They all said, 'That's right.'

source_sentence: 即共分割，魚受楚苦發大叫聲。
translation: They then divided it together, and the fish suffered pain and cried out in pain.

source_sentence: 是時漁人之中有一童子，見如斯事生歡喜心。
translation: At the time, there was a boy among the fishermen who saw such things and became joyous.

source_sentence: 時二大魚而作是念：『我實無辜，橫加劇苦。
translation: The two big fish then thought, 'I'm really not guilty, and I've caused untold suffering.

source_sentence: 當來之世此等生處我亦生彼，雖無罪犯，我苦殺之。』
translation: In a future life, where this is the place of birth, I'll also be born there, and even though there's no offense, I'll painfully kill them.'

translation: You monks, don't give rise to different thoughts. Those two fish are the bad and painful mothers, and those five hundred fishermen are the five hundred Śākyamunis.
